page.title: 07Footscray Meadows.
page.content: Footscray Meadows is an uncultivated measure of land which is used for recreation, especially in the Summer. The{River Cray}runs through the middle of the area and under a large bridge with five arches (The Meadow is sometimes called{Five Arches}).It is mainly{grassland}but there is a small wood.Ducks can be seen on the river as well as some fish in it: stikklebacks, minoes etc. A variety of other {wildlife}can be seen including foxes, at night, rummaging for food. Local{primary schools}use the fields for games lessons, with{local churches holding fetes etc on them also. Canoeing sometimes takes place on the river. The general public use the fields most of all,{sports clubs}etc, as well as the local groups of Cubs, Brownies, Guides and Scouts.It is a very{picturesque area of Sidcup.
